Aprepitant, Dexamethasone, and Ondansetron are all used in the management of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting. Aprepitant is a substance P antagonist that effectively reduces nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy. Dexamethasone, a corticosteroid, has anti-inflammatory properties that can help alleviate nausea in this context. Ondansetron is a 5-HT3 receptor antagonist that is commonly used to prevent nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy. Therefore, the option 'All of the above' is correct as it encompasses all three agents, each contributing to the management of chemotherapy-induced vomiting.
